name: HEIC to JPG
description: Convert HEIC photos to JPG format

tool.title: HEIC to JPG
tool.subtitle: Convert Apple HEIC images to universally compatible JPG format.

faqs.question: What is HEIC format?
faqs.answer: HEIC (High Efficiency Image Container) is Apple's default image format for photos taken on iPhone and iPad devices running iOS 11 or later. It uses HEIF compression to save storage space while maintaining high quality.

faqs.question: Why do I need to convert HEIC to JPG?
faqs.answer: While HEIC offers excellent compression, many devices, applications, and websites don't support it. Converting to JPG ensures your photos can be viewed and shared on any platform without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Will converting HEIC to JPG reduce quality?
faqs.answer: Our converter maintains optimal quality during conversion. While JPG uses different compression, we ensure minimal quality loss while producing files that work everywhere.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert multiple HEIC files?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can drag and drop or select multiple HEIC files to convert them all to JPG at once. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically.

faqs.question: Is my privacy protected?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. All conversions happen locally in your browser. Your photos never leave your device and aren't uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy.

aboutSection.title: HEIC vs JPG: Understanding the Formats

name: HEIC to JPEG
description: Convert HEIC photos to JPEG format

tool.title: HEIC to JPEG
tool.subtitle: Convert iPhone HEIC photos to universally compatible JPEG format.

faqs.question: What's the difference between JPG and JPEG?
faqs.answer: There's no difference - they're the same format. JPEG is the full name, while JPG was used for older Windows systems that required 3-letter extensions.

faqs.question: Will I lose photo quality?
faqs.answer: There's minimal quality loss with our optimized conversion. We use high-quality settings to preserve as much detail as possible while ensuring compatibility.

faqs.question: Are Live Photos supported?
faqs.answer: The still image from Live Photos is converted to JPEG. The motion component requires video format conversion for full preservation.

faqs.question: Can I convert HEIC burst photos?
faqs.answer: Yes, burst photos stored as HEIC can be converted. Each photo in the burst will be converted to a separate JPEG file.

faqs.question: Why do iPhones use HEIC?
faqs.answer: Apple adopted HEIC to save storage space - files are about half the size of JPEG with similar quality. However, this creates compatibility issues with non-Apple devices.

name: HEIC to PNG
description: Convert HEIC photos to PNG format

tool.title: HEIC to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert iPhone HEIC photos to PNG format with lossless quality.

faqs.question: Why convert HEIC to PNG instead of JPG?
faqs.answer: PNG provides lossless compression, preserving every detail of your photos. It's ideal when you need maximum quality for editing or when you want to add transparency later.

faqs.question: How large will the PNG files be?
faqs.answer: PNG files are typically 5-10x larger than HEIC files since PNG uses lossless compression. The exact size depends on image complexity and color variety.

faqs.question: Is all metadata preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, important metadata like camera settings, date taken, and location (if present) are preserved in the PNG file's metadata chunks.

faqs.question: Can I add transparency to photos?
faqs.answer: The converter maintains the original image. To add transparency, you'll need to edit the PNG file afterward using image editing software.

faqs.question: Should I use PNG for all my iPhone photos?
faqs.answer: PNG is best for photos you plan to edit extensively or need maximum quality. For general sharing and storage, JPG is more practical due to smaller file sizes.

faqs.question: Why convert HEIC to PDF?
faqs.answer: PDF is ideal for sharing photos in documents, creating photo portfolios, or when you need images in a document format that preserves layout and can't be easily edited.

faqs.question: Can I combine multiple HEIC images into one PDF?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple HEIC files and combine them into a single multi-page PDF document, perfect for creating photo albums or portfolios.

faqs.question: What's the PDF quality like?
faqs.answer: The PDF maintains high quality with customizable compression settings. You can choose between high quality for printing or compressed for email sharing.

faqs.question: Are the PDFs searchable?
faqs.answer: The PDFs contain images only and are not searchable. For searchable PDFs, you would need OCR (Optical Character Recognition) software.

faqs.question: Can I set PDF page size?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can choose from standard page sizes (A4, Letter, etc.) or use auto-fit to match the image dimensions.

name: HEIF to JPG
description: Convert HEIF images to JPG format

tool.title: HEIF to JPG
tool.subtitle: Convert HEIF images to universally compatible JPG format.

faqs.question: What is HEIF format?
faqs.answer: HEIF (High Efficiency Image Format) is a modern container format that can store images and image sequences. It's the underlying technology behind Apple's HEIC format, offering better compression than JPEG.

faqs.question: Is HEIF the same as HEIC?
faqs.answer: HEIC is Apple's implementation of HEIF. While HEIF is the broader standard, HEIC specifically uses HEVC codec for compression. Both offer similar benefits over traditional formats.

faqs.question: Why convert HEIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: JPG has universal support across all devices and software. Converting HEIF to JPG ensures your images can be viewed, edited, and shared without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Will image quality be affected?
faqs.answer: Our converter uses optimized settings to minimize quality loss. While some compression artifacts may appear, the visual difference is typically negligible for most uses.

faqs.question: Can I convert HEIF image sequences?
faqs.answer: Yes, HEIF files containing image sequences are supported. Each image in the sequence can be extracted and converted to individual JPG files.

tool.title: HEIF to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert HEIF images to PNG format with lossless quality.

faqs.question: Why choose PNG over JPG for HEIF conversion?
faqs.answer: PNG offers lossless compression, preserving every detail from your HEIF images. It's ideal for images with text, graphics, or when you need to maintain maximum quality for editing.

faqs.question: Is transparency supported?
faqs.answer: Yes, if your HEIF image contains transparency information, it will be preserved in the PNG output with full alpha channel support.

faqs.question: How do file sizes compare?
faqs.answer: PNG files are typically 3-5x larger than HEIF due to lossless compression. The trade-off is perfect quality preservation and universal compatibility.

faqs.question: Can I convert HEIF sequences?
faqs.answer: Yes, HEIF sequences can be converted with each frame saved as a separate PNG file, maintaining the highest quality for each image.

faqs.question: What about color profiles?
faqs.answer: Color profiles and metadata are preserved during conversion, ensuring accurate color reproduction in the PNG output.

name: PDF to JPG
description: Convert PDF pages to JPG images

tool.title: PDF to JPG
tool.subtitle: Extract high-quality JPG images from PDF documents instantly

faqs.question: How are multi-page PDFs handled?
faqs.answer: Each page of your PDF is converted to a separate JPG image, numbered sequentially (page1.jpg, page2.jpg, etc.). This makes it easy to work with individual pages or share specific content.

faqs.question: What resolution are the JPG images?
faqs.answer: Images are rendered at high resolution (2x scale) to ensure clarity. The output maintains the PDF's visual quality while being suitable for web use, printing, or sharing.

faqs.question: Can I convert password-protected PDFs?
faqs.answer: Currently, only unprotected PDFs can be converted. Password-protected or encrypted PDFs need to be unlocked first using PDF software before conversion.

faqs.question: What about text in PDFs?
faqs.answer: Text is rendered as part of the image. The JPG output will show all text exactly as it appears in the PDF, but it won't be selectable or searchable as text.

faqs.question: Are forms and annotations preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, all visible elements including form fields, annotations, stamps, and comments are rendered in the JPG output as they appear in the PDF.

tool.subtitle: Convert PDF pages to high-quality PNG images with transparency.

faqs.question: Why choose PNG over JPG for PDFs?
faqs.answer: PNG is better for PDFs containing text, diagrams, or graphics as it provides lossless compression and sharper edges. It also supports transparency for PDFs with transparent backgrounds.

faqs.question: What resolution are the PNG files?
faqs.answer: PNGs are generated at 150 DPI by default, with options up to 300 DPI for print quality. Higher resolutions produce sharper images but larger file sizes.

faqs.question: Can I convert specific pages only?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select specific pages or page ranges to convert, rather than processing the entire document.

faqs.question: Are transparent PDFs supported?
faqs.answer: Yes, PDFs with transparent backgrounds are converted to PNGs with alpha channel transparency preserved.

faqs.question: How are vector PDFs handled?
faqs.answer: Vector content in PDFs is rasterized at your chosen resolution. For best quality with vector content, use higher DPI settings.

faqs.question: Can I combine multiple JPEGs into one PDF?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple JPEG files and combine them into a single multi-page PDF. You can also arrange the page order before conversion.

faqs.question: What's the PDF file size?
faqs.answer: PDF size depends on your compression settings. High quality preserves original JPEG quality but creates larger files, while compressed settings reduce file size for easier sharing.

faqs.question: Can I add margins or resize images?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can fit images to standard page sizes with margins, maintain original dimensions, or scale to fit while preserving aspect ratio.

faqs.question: Is the PDF editable?

faqs.question: Can I password protect the PDF?
faqs.answer: Basic PDF creation doesn't include password protection, but you can use PDF security tools after conversion to add passwords and restrictions.

name: JPEG to PNG
description: Convert JPEG to PNG format

tool.title: JPEG to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert JPEG images to PNG format for better quality and transparency.

faqs.question: Why convert JPEG to PNG?
faqs.answer: PNG is better for images with text, logos, or graphics that need sharp edges. It also supports transparency, which JPEG doesn't, making it ideal for overlays and design work.

faqs.question: Will converting improve image quality?
faqs.answer: Converting won't improve quality that was already lost in JPEG compression, but PNG will preserve the current quality without further degradation during editing.

faqs.question: How much will the file size increase?
faqs.answer: PNG files are typically 5-10x larger than JPEGs for photographic images. For graphics with fewer colors, PNG can actually be smaller.

faqs.question: Can I add transparency to JPEG images?
faqs.answer: The converter maintains the original image. To add transparency, you'll need to use an image editor after conversion to remove backgrounds.

faqs.question: Should I convert photos to PNG?
faqs.answer: Generally no - JPEG is better for photos. Convert to PNG only when you need transparency, lossless editing, or are working with graphics and text.

name: JPEG to JPG
description: Convert JPEG to JPG format

tool.title: JPEG to JPG
tool.subtitle: Rename JPEG files to JPG extension for better compatibility.

faqs.question: Is there any difference between JPEG and JPG?
faqs.answer: No, they're identical formats. JPG is simply a shortened version of JPEG, originally used for DOS/Windows systems that required 3-letter file extensions.

faqs.question: Why do both extensions exist?
faqs.answer: Historical reasons - older Windows systems required 3-letter extensions (.jpg), while other systems used the full .jpeg. Both are now universally supported.

faqs.question: Will converting affect image quality?
faqs.answer: No quality change occurs. This simply renames the file extension while keeping the image data exactly the same.

faqs.question: Which extension should I use?
faqs.answer: .jpg is more common and slightly more compatible with older systems, though both work everywhere in modern applications.

faqs.question: Are all properties preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, all image data, metadata, EXIF information, and color profiles remain unchanged. Only the file extension is modified.

faqs.question: Is transparency preserved when converting?
faqs.answer: Yes, WebP images with transparency (alpha channel) are converted to PNG with full transparency support. The alpha channel is perfectly preserved.

faqs.question: Why convert WebP to PNG?
faqs.answer: While WebP offers better compression, PNG has universal support across all software, browsers, and devices. PNG is also required for many design tools and older systems.

faqs.question: Will the file size increase?
faqs.answer: Yes, PNG files are typically 30-50% larger than WebP. However, PNG offers lossless compression and universal compatibility, making it worth the trade-off in many cases.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert multiple WebP files?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select or drag multiple WebP files for batch conversion. Each file is processed and downloaded automatically.

faqs.question: Are animated WebP files supported?
faqs.answer: Static WebP images are fully supported. Animated WebP files will be converted to a static PNG of the first frame.

tool.title: AVIF to PNG

faqs.question: Is AVIF transparency preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, AVIF images with alpha channels are converted to PNG with full transparency support. The conversion maintains all transparency information perfectly.

faqs.question: Why convert AVIF to PNG?
faqs.answer: While AVIF offers superior compression, PNG has universal support across all software and platforms. Many design tools and older systems don't support AVIF yet.

faqs.question: Will HDR content be preserved?
faqs.answer: HDR AVIF images are tone-mapped to standard dynamic range for PNG output, as PNG doesn't support HDR. The conversion aims to preserve as much visual information as possible.

faqs.question: How much larger will PNG files be?
faqs.answer: PNG files are typically 3-5x larger than AVIF files. The exact increase depends on image content, with photographs showing the largest size increase.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert AVIF files?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple AVIF files for batch conversion. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically.

name: AVIF to JPG
description: Convert AVIF to JPG format

tool.title: AVIF to JPG
tool.subtitle: Convert AVIF images to JPG format instantly in your browser.

faqs.question: What is AVIF format?
faqs.answer: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image format that provides superior compression compared to JPEG, PNG, and even WebP. It was developed by the Alliance for Open Media and supports both lossy and lossless compression.

faqs.question: Why convert AVIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: While AVIF offers better compression and quality, JPG/JPEG is still the most widely supported image format across all devices, browsers, and applications. Converting AVIF to JPG ensures maximum compatibility for sharing and viewing images.

faqs.question: Is the conversion done on my device?
faqs.answer: Yes! All conversions happen directly in your browser. Your images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security. No files are uploaded to any server.

faqs.question: What's the maximum file size I can convert?
faqs.answer: Our converter can handle files up to 50MB each. For larger files, consider using desktop software or breaking them into smaller batches.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality when converting from AVIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: Some quality loss may occur since JPG uses different compression algorithms than AVIF. However, we optimize the conversion to maintain the best possible quality while keeping file sizes reasonable.

faqs.question: Can I convert multiple AVIF files at once?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can select or drag multiple AVIF files to convert them all to JPG format in one batch. Each file will be processed and downloaded individually.

aboutSection.title: Understanding AVIF and JPG Formats

tool.title: GIF to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert GIF images to PNG format with better quality and smaller sizes.

faqs.question: What happens to animated GIFs?
faqs.answer: Animated GIFs are converted to a static PNG of the first frame. For full animation extraction, each frame can be saved as a separate PNG file.

faqs.question: Is transparency preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, GIF transparency is fully preserved in the PNG output. PNG actually handles transparency better with full alpha channel support versus GIF's binary transparency.

faqs.question: Will the quality improve?
faqs.answer: PNG supports millions of colors compared to GIF's 256 color limit. While we can't add detail that wasn't there, gradients and colors will be preserved better.

faqs.question: Why is my PNG smaller than the GIF?
faqs.answer: For simple graphics, PNG's compression is often more efficient than GIF, resulting in smaller files with better quality.

faqs.question: Can I convert old GIF images?
faqs.answer: Yes, converting old GIFs to PNG is a great way to preserve them with better quality and prepare them for modern use.

name: JFIF to JPG
description: Convert JFIF to JPG format

tool.title: JFIF to JPG
tool.subtitle: Convert JFIF images to standard JPG format instantly.

faqs.question: What is JFIF format?
faqs.answer: JFIF (JPEG File Interchange Format) is actually a type of JPEG file with specific metadata. It's the same image data as JPG but with a different extension.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality converting JFIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: No quality loss occurs because JFIF and JPG use the same compression. The conversion simply changes the file extension and ensures standard JPG compatibility.

faqs.question: Why do some images save as JFIF?
faqs.answer: Some browsers and applications save JPEG images with the .jfif extension, especially when copying images from the web. It's the same format, just labeled differently.

faqs.question: Can all programs open JFIF files?
faqs.answer: While JFIF is technically JPEG, some programs don't recognize the .jfif extension. Converting to .jpg ensures universal compatibility.

faqs.question: Is metadata preserved during conversion?
faqs.answer: Yes, all image metadata including EXIF data, color profiles, and other information is preserved during the conversion.

aboutSection.title: JFIF to JPG: Standardizing File Extensions

toFormat.name: JPG

name: JFIF to JPEG
description: Convert JFIF to JPEG format

tool.title: JFIF to JPEG
tool.subtitle: Convert JFIF files to standard JPEG extension instantly.

faqs.question: Are JFIF and JPEG the same format?
faqs.answer: Yes, JFIF (JPEG File Interchange Format) is just a specific type of JPEG file. The only difference is the file extension - the image data is identical.

faqs.question: Why do I have JFIF files?
faqs.answer: Some browsers and applications save JPEG images with the .jfif extension, particularly when downloading or copying images from websites.

faqs.question: Will conversion affect quality?
faqs.answer: No quality loss occurs since this is just renaming the extension. The image data remains exactly the same - only the file extension changes.

faqs.question: Which extension is better?
faqs.answer: JPEG (.jpeg or .jpg) is more widely recognized and compatible. While JFIF files work in most modern software, JPEG ensures maximum compatibility.

faqs.question: Is all data preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, everything including image data, metadata, EXIF information, and color profiles remains unchanged during the conversion.

name: JFIF to PNG
description: Convert JFIF to PNG format

tool.title: JFIF to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert JFIF images to PNG format with lossless quality.

faqs.question: Why convert JFIF to PNG?
faqs.answer: PNG offers lossless compression and transparency support, making it ideal for graphics, logos, and images that need editing. It also avoids the .jfif extension compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Will the file size increase?
faqs.answer: Yes, PNG files are typically 5-10x larger than JFIF/JPEG for photos. However, for graphics with few colors, PNG can actually be smaller while providing better quality.

faqs.question: Can I add transparency?
faqs.answer: The converter maintains the original image. To add transparency, you'll need to edit the PNG afterward using image editing software to remove backgrounds.

faqs.question: Is quality improved?
faqs.answer: Converting to PNG preserves current quality without further loss, but it cannot restore quality already lost in the original JPEG compression.

faqs.question: When should I use PNG?
faqs.answer: Use PNG for graphics, logos, screenshots, and images with text. For photos, JFIF/JPEG is usually more efficient unless you need lossless quality.

tool.title: JFIF to PDF
tool.subtitle: Convert JFIF images to PDF documents for professional sharing.

faqs.question: Can I merge multiple JFIF files into one PDF?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple JFIF files and combine them into a single multi-page PDF document, with options to arrange page order.

faqs.question: What quality settings are available?
faqs.answer: You can choose from high quality (preserves original), medium (balanced), or compressed (smaller file size) depending on your needs.

faqs.question: Can I set custom page sizes?
faqs.answer: Yes, choose from standard sizes (A4, Letter, Legal) or custom dimensions. Images can be scaled to fit or maintain original dimensions.

faqs.question: Will JFIF metadata be preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, image metadata including EXIF data is preserved and embedded in the PDF document.

faqs.question: Is the PDF searchable?
faqs.answer: The PDF contains images only. For searchable text, you'd need OCR software to recognize text within the images.

name: JPG to SVG

tool.title: JPG to SVG
tool.subtitle: Convert JPG images to scalable vector graphics format.

faqs.question: How does raster to vector conversion work?
faqs.answer: The converter traces the shapes and colors in your JPG image to create vector paths. Simple graphics with clear shapes work best, while complex photos may result in large, detailed SVGs.

faqs.question: Will my photo look the same as SVG?
faqs.answer: Photos converted to SVG will have a stylized, posterized appearance. SVG works best for logos, icons, and simple graphics rather than photographic images.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of SVG?
faqs.answer: SVG files are infinitely scalable without quality loss, editable in design software, and often smaller than raster images for simple graphics. They're perfect for responsive web design.

faqs.question: Can I edit the resulting SVG?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVG files can be edited in vector graphics software like Illustrator, Inkscape, or even with a text editor since SVG is an XML-based format.

faqs.question: When should I use SVG instead of JPG?
faqs.answer: Use SVG for logos, icons, diagrams, and simple illustrations that need to scale. Keep JPG for photographs and complex images with many colors and details.

name: CSV Combiner
description: Combine multiple CSV files into one

tool.title: CSV Combiner
tool.subtitle: Merge multiple CSV files into one seamlessly in your browser.

faqs.question: How does CSV combining work?
faqs.answer: Our CSV combiner merges multiple CSV files by aligning columns with matching headers. It intelligently handles different column orders and missing columns, creating a unified dataset.

faqs.question: What happens to duplicate headers?
faqs.answer: When files have the same column headers, the data is merged vertically (rows are appended). If headers differ, new columns are created and empty cells are filled with blank values for missing data.

faqs.question: Is there a file size limit?
faqs.answer: You can combine CSV files up to 50MB each. The tool processes files locally in your browser, so performance depends on your device's memory.

faqs.question: Can I combine files with different encodings?
faqs.answer: Yes, the tool automatically detects and handles various text encodings including UTF-8, UTF-16, and ASCII, ensuring proper character display in the merged file.

faqs.question: How are different delimiters handled?
faqs.answer: The combiner auto-detects delimiters (comma, semicolon, tab, pipe) in each file and standardizes them to your chosen output format.

aboutSection.title: Understanding CSV Files and Data Merging

name: JSON to CSV
description: Convert JSON data to CSV format

tool.title: JSON to CSV
tool.subtitle: Convert JSON data to CSV format for spreadsheets and data analysis.

faqs.question: What is JSON?
faqs.answer: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight, human-readable data format used for storing and exchanging structured data between systems. It uses key-value pairs and arrays to represent complex data structures.

faqs.question: Why convert JSON to CSV?
faqs.answer: CSV format is ideal for importing data into spreadsheet applications like Excel or Google Sheets, data analysis tools, and databases. It provides a simple tabular structure that's easy to work with.

faqs.question: How does nested JSON data get converted?
faqs.answer: Nested objects are flattened into columns using dot notation (e.g., 'address.city'), while arrays can be expanded into multiple rows or concatenated into single cells depending on your preference.

faqs.question: Can I customize the CSV output?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can choose which fields to include, set custom column headers, select delimiters (comma, tab, semicolon), and configure how arrays and nested objects are handled.

faqs.question: What's the maximum JSON file size?
faqs.answer: Our converter can handle JSON files up to 25MB. For larger datasets, consider splitting them or using specialized data processing tools.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: All processing happens locally in your browser. Your JSON data never leaves your device, ensuring complete privacy and security of sensitive information.

aboutSection.title: JSON vs CSV: Data Format Comparison

fromFormat.name: JSON
fromFormat.description: JSON is a language-independent open data format that uses human-readable text to express data objects consisting of attribute-value pairs. Although originally derived from JavaScript, JSON data can be generated and parsed with a wide variety of programming languages.

toFormat.name: CSV
toFormat.description: CSV is a simple file format used to store tabular data in plain text. Each line represents a data record, with fields separated by commas. It's universally supported by spreadsheet applications and databases.

name: Character Counter
description: Count characters, words, and lines

tool.title: Character Counter
tool.subtitle: Count characters, words, sentences, and paragraphs instantly.

faqs.question: What does the character counter measure?
faqs.answer: Our tool counts characters (with and without spaces), words, sentences, paragraphs, and lines. It also shows reading time and speaking time estimates.

faqs.question: How accurate is the word count?
faqs.answer: The word counter uses advanced algorithms to accurately identify words across multiple languages, handling contractions, hyphenated words, and special characters correctly.

faqs.question: Does it work with all languages?
faqs.answer: Yes, the counter supports all Unicode languages including English, Chinese, Arabic, Hindi, and more. It correctly handles different writing systems and character sets.

faqs.question: Can I set character limits?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can set custom limits for characters or words and see real-time feedback as you type, perfect for Twitter posts, SMS messages, or essay requirements.

faqs.question: Is my text saved or stored?
faqs.answer: No, all counting happens locally in your browser. Your text is never sent to any server, ensuring complete privacy.
